title: India vs Australia, Live Cricket Scores Virat Kohli vs Steve Smith as hosts look to extend unbeaten run : Cricket, News - India Today
text:
Cricket India vs Australia, Live Cricket Scores Virat Kohli vs Steve Smith as hosts look to extend unbeaten run India take on Australia in a much anticipated Test series. The first match will be played in Pune. Catch all live updates here. â€” BCCI (@BCCI) 23 February 2017 
Hours after one Australian team played out a T20 International in Adelaide, another Australian team will take on India in a Test match, 9044 kilometers away. ( Full preview ) 
India and Australia are set to face off in the first of four Test matches in Pune today and it will be a battle of attrition. While the hosts are undeafeted in their last 19 Tests, the visitors have just about found a combination that they are certain of lasting them for some time to come. 
However, Australia's plans seem to have been thrown out of the window with the pitch in Pune looking like it could take turn from Day 1. 
Steve Smith went on record to say he has not yet seen a pitch look like that before the start of a Test match. Virat Kohli feels the turn would be rather slow. How the surface plays out will become clear over the next couple of hours but it is unlikely to be easy for the Aussies, who were hammered in all four Tests on their last visit almost four years ago. 
Smith did concede that Australia are the underdogs in the series against the world's number one side. Australia will hope that their new boys live up to the promise they showed back home. 
Kohli will obviosly expect his men to keep up the excellent work that has resulted eight wins out of nine Tests this home season. 
A RARE SIGHT 
The world's top two Test teams, the two best batsmen in Test (Smith and Kohli) and the three best Test bowlers in the world (R Ashwin, Ravindra Jadeja and Josh Hazlewood) could feature in the Test. However, so heavily are conditions stacked in favour of spin that Australia might even drop Hazlewood instead of an extra spinner. 
RECENT CONTESTS 
India had whitewashed Australia in the four-Test series back in 2013 while Australia won 2-0 in 2014-15. 
RECENT CONQUESTS 
India have been on a high, having won three successive series at home vs New Zealand, England and Bangladesh. Australia lost a three-match series to South Africa before blanking Pakistan with a new-look team. 
Virat Kohli issues Mitchell Starc warning to India's batsmen in Pune 
Australia paceman Mitchell Starc has raised his game to the next level and India's batsmen need to be wary of his ability to trouble them with reverse swing, home captain Virat Kohli said on the eve of the first Test beginning on Thursday. ( Read more ) 
Five reasons why Australia should be wary of Virat Kohli's Invincibles 
India and Australia square off in a four-Test series from February 23. What are the major challenges for the visitors against Kohli's Invincibles ? Is it just the spinners or the turning tracks? Or will it be the packed stands that could intimidate the Aussies? Then there's the question of tackling Virat Kohli.
